Stories from 19 February 2017

19 February 2017

Fleeing the Shells of War, Kachin Civilians Struggle Against Freezing Cold in North Myanmar Link: https://globalvoices.org/2017/02/19/fleeing-the-shells-of-war-kachin-civilians-struggle-against-freezing-cold-in-north-myanmar/

Written by The Irrawaddy Link: https://globalvoices.org/author/the-irrawaddy/ · East Asia Link: https://globalvoices.org/-/world/east-asia/

Almost 2,000 fled their villages after recent skirmishes between the Kachin Independence Army and the Myanmar army

Aussie Media Cop Criticism for Coverage of Olympic Swimming Gold Medalist's Meltdown Link: https://globalvoices.org/2017/02/19/aussie-media-cop-criticism-for-coverage-of-olympic-swimming-gold-medalists-meltdown/

Written by Kevin Rennie Link: https://globalvoices.org/author/kevin-rennie/ · Oceania Link: https://globalvoices.org/-/world/oceania/

"Please consider the impact of sustained coverage on the #mentalhealth of a celebrity – important to be respectful." #GrantHackett

Whale-Themed ‘Suicide Groups’ Present Opportunity for Internet Crackdown in Central Asia Link: https://globalvoices.org/2017/02/19/whale-themed-suicide-groups-present-opportunity-for-internet-crackdown-in-central-asia/

Written by Akhal-Tech Collective Link: https://globalvoices.org/author/winston-olsen/ · Central Asia & Caucasus Link: https://globalvoices.org/-/world/central-asia-caucasus/

Despite no clear link to actual suicides in Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan, authorities are dreaming up restrictions.

Thousands Joined ‘Walk for Life’ to Protest Extrajudicial Killings and Revival of Death Penalty in the Philippines Link: https://globalvoices.org/2017/02/19/thousands-joined-walk-for-life-to-protest-extrajudicial-killings-and-revival-of-death-penalty-in-the-philippines/

Written by Mong Palatino Link: https://globalvoices.org/author/mong/ · East Asia Link: https://globalvoices.org/-/world/east-asia/

"If the response to violence is also violence, we double the violence. We should match it with non-violence."

China Argues Over Which Country is Behind Kim Jong-nam Assassination Link: https://globalvoices.org/2017/02/19/china-disputes-over-which-country-is-behind-kim-jong-nam-assassination/

Written by Oiwan Lam Link: https://globalvoices.org/author/oiwan/ · East Asia Link: https://globalvoices.org/-/world/east-asia/

Old school pundits are still trying to drum up support for Beijing's troublesome ally, but social media users aren't buying it.
